DOC.brief_summary: The major goal of this project is to identify the role of the immune responses in the emergence of protease inhibitor mutants during therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating the Role of Immune Responses in the Emergence of Protease Inhibitor Mutations
DOC.detailed_description: Objective 1: Evaluate the role of the immune responses in determining the emergence of HCV NS3 resistance mutation during protease inhibitor therapy Hypothesis 1 (HT 1): Low HLA binding to peptides containing protease inhibitor resistance mutations is associated with the emergence of protease inhibitor mutants during therapy and failure of the treatment. Hypothesis 2 (HT 2): A hole in T cell repertoire may allow emergence of protease inhibitor mutants during protease inhibitor therapy which leads to loss of the immune responses to these mutants and failure of treatment.
